<a id="class_XRNode3D"></a>

# XRNode3D

**Inherits:** [Node3D](class_node3d.md) **<** [Node](class_node.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

**Inherited By:** [XRAnchor3D](class_xranchor3d.md), [XRController3D](class_xrcontroller3d.md)

A 3D node that has its position automatically updated by the [XRServer](class_xrserver.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This node can be bound to a specific pose of an [XRPositionalTracker](class_xrpositionaltracker.md) and will automatically have its [Node3D.transform](class_node3d.md#class_Node3D_property_transform) updated by the [XRServer](class_xrserver.md). Nodes of this type must be added as children of the [XROrigin3D](class_xrorigin3d.md) node.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [XR documentation index](../tutorials/xr/index.md)

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Signals

<a id="class_XRNode3D_signal_tracking_changed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**tracking_changed**\ (\ tracking\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_signal_tracking_changed)

Emitted when the [tracker](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_tracker) starts or stops receiving updated tracking data for the [pose](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_pose) being tracked. The `tracking` argument indicates whether the tracker is getting updated tracking data.

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_XRNode3D_property_pose"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[StringName](class_stringname.md) **pose** = `&"default"` [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_property_pose)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pose_name**\ (\ value\: [StringName](class_stringname.md)\ )
- [StringName](class_stringname.md) **get_pose_name**\ (\ )

The name of the pose we're bound to. Which poses a tracker supports is not known during design time.

Redot defines number of standard pose names such as ``aim`` and ``grip`` but other may be configured within a given [XRInterface](class_xrinterface.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_XRNode3D_property_show_when_tracked"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **show_when_tracked** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_property_show_when_tracked)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_show_when_tracked**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **get_show_when_tracked**\ (\ )

Enables showing the node when tracking starts, and hiding the node when tracking is lost.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_XRNode3D_property_tracker"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[StringName](class_stringname.md) **tracker** = `&""` [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_property_tracker)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tracker**\ (\ value\: [StringName](class_stringname.md)\ )
- [StringName](class_stringname.md) **get_tracker**\ (\ )

The name of the tracker we're bound to. Which trackers are available is not known during design time.

Redot defines a number of standard trackers such as ``left_hand`` and ``right_hand`` but others may be configured within a given [XRInterface](class_xrinterface.md).

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_XRNode3D_method_get_has_tracking_data"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **get_has_tracking_data**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_method_get_has_tracking_data)

Returns ``true`` if the [tracker](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_tracker) has current tracking data for the [pose](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_pose) being tracked.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_XRNode3D_method_get_is_active"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **get_is_active**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_method_get_is_active)

Returns ``true`` if the [tracker](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_tracker) has been registered and the [pose](class_xrnode3d.md#class_XRNode3D_property_pose) is being tracked.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_XRNode3D_method_get_pose"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[XRPose](class_xrpose.md) **get_pose**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_method_get_pose)

Returns the [XRPose](class_xrpose.md) containing the current state of the pose being tracked. This gives access to additional properties of this pose.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_XRNode3D_method_trigger_haptic_pulse"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **trigger_haptic_pulse**\ (\ action_name\: [String](class_string.md), frequency\: [float](class_float.md), amplitude\: [float](class_float.md), duration_sec\: [float](class_float.md), delay_sec\: [float](class_float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_XRNode3D_method_trigger_haptic_pulse)

Triggers a haptic pulse on a device associated with this interface.

\ `action_name` is the name of the action for this pulse.

\ `frequency` is the frequency of the pulse, set to ``0.0`` to have the system use a default frequency.

\ `amplitude` is the amplitude of the pulse between ``0.0`` and ``1.0``.

\ `duration_sec` is the duration of the pulse in seconds.

\ `delay_sec` is a delay in seconds before the pulse is given.
